reviews.review_msg: Didn't go to class at all just listened to the recordings. His notes have like 3 sentences on them per slide so write down everything he says. He explains this really well. Understand whats going on and the midterm for animals will be so easy. Write a lot om the midterm, be as detailed as possible to get full marks. He's great
Over all a really good prof, good lecturers. Class content was interesting. Exams were long but marking is fair. Would definitely recommend taking this class with him!

This was one of my favorite classes this semester. Julian goes at a really good pace when teaching and doesn't expect you to have too much previous knowledge. The course material is also very interesting. I found he was a fair grader and if the average was low for an exam, he curved up.

Dr. Christians is an awesome prof. He's kind, and he gives tons of practice questions on MasteringGenetics. The midterms have variations of the practice Qs so if you do as many as you can you'll be prepared for the time crunch.

Although he is a good professor in terms of teaching, the fact that for the exams we had to be very specific for the questions made me fell upset. Dr. Christians is a very tough grader and he was looking for specific answers in terms of the exam questions. Overall, he is a nice person but I would not recommend taking a class with him.

Dr. Christians nice person, not a good lecturer. He's open to questions which is nice, and I reccomend asking. Exams are not your standard exams, you could study lots but it means nothing if you don't know how to problem solve with his questions. I suggest going to all lectures and focusing on all clicker questions that he asks.

Julian was a great prof, if you pay attention to how he describes the way to approach his exam questions you'll be fine. He is a bit picky so there is lots to know but the way he teaches the material gives you a good base to build from for the rest of your undergrad courses. Highly recommend!
Gives tests that are too long for the time allocated. Also not helpful for one on one visits

He explains the content really well. He makes the lectures interesting and I never got bored in his class. If you love biology then you will really love his style of teaching. Would definitely recommend this professor to anyone.

Julian was a great choice - friendly, patient. Did his best to answer questions in lecture, even when unsure of the answer. He listened to feedback that MT1 was too long and made MT2 shorter. Written Qs in the exams were similar to weekly quiz questions. The final was very similar to the sample. Not your average bio class. Practice the material.

He is an okay prof who knows his material well. Clickers are a good way to study for exams as well as his tutorial slides. Exams are long but they are fair. Went to his office hours to get help for the practice final but he told me to go look at the slides & didn't provide much help. He was much more helpful after lecture tho on the same day^
This guy is the guy you want to take a class with. He really understands his subjects.

This class is going to be my first fail. I failed the first 2 midterms. The midterms are brutal, as they are too long to finish in 50 mins. None of the questions he used in the practice midterm are on the midterms :/ He's too hard, avoid him.

He gave us practice midterms and did not provide an answer key and told us to compare answers with other students. He said the problem was that students will memorize answers or post the practice exams online. While that is understandable, we had no idea if we were doing anything right or not. His lecture notes are hectic and confusing as well.

11/10 guy very lean, brings green towel in to lecture and says it's brown (he's colourblind) but v cool guy real nice, lectures recorded (video and audio) DO NOT NEED TO ATTEND @ all, but maybe show up for midterms?? & final

A very caring and understating professor with a clear grading criteria, Dr. Christians provides lots of practice questions that are similar to the midterm and final. As for every class, take advantage of the office hours, and if you don't understand something make sure to ask.

Incredibly well organized class. Gives you everything you need to do well. Lectures were interesting and well coordinated and the Clicker question not only tested your understanding, but drew attention to common exam errors. Exams were quick but more than fair. Favourite class and prof so far.

He's changed up his genetics course from now on. Tests are fair, midterms have balance of hard and easy questions. Final was the most standard final I've ever written, very fair with no surprises. Lecture notes leave some things out so listen to recordings when it seems like something isn't explained fully on slides.

Tough tests. You have to understand the material, which isn't easy, to do well on the exams. Memorization will absolutely not help. Exams are all problem solving and intepretation of novel data. Hard course but rewarding if physiology is an interest.

His lectures were very interesting and his analogies made concepts much clearer. His midterms were fair but he marks VERY HARD. You MUST be EXTREMELY specific or you'll lose marks. The final was tricky. He would put in alternate terms of familiar things to trick you (e.g. instead of hemoglobin like in all his slides, it'll be respiratory pigments)

Condescending and arrogant, he used copy and pasted lecture notes and MasteringGenetics problem sets so he's clearly in the pocket of textbook companies and not willing to put any effort whatsoever into actually teaching the course. Bad attitude towards students and very difficult exams.

I am usually very good at biology courses, however, genetics with this professor really shot down my confidence. His exams were very hard, nothing like mastering genetics and also he was quite rude whenever I would come for help. I studied off of his notes mostly but that was no help so if you take it with him learn everything on your own.
I don't know about his other classes, he might be good at them. However, his genetics class was a surprise, especially his final exam. He loves problem sets, but rarely explains them.
He barely goes over problem sets, but he expects you to know everything. his notes are all textbook copy paste.

If you are taking genetics do not sign up for it w him!!! His lectures are bad enough and he does not test u in theory at all... He never goes over problems and he expects u to know everything he is only there re-reading the book!!! This course with him is a self(book)teaching and expect to be surprise
Definitely need to attend lectures, but overall good class. Marking is fair and he tries to make everything interesting and relevant!

Julian is a pretty good professor all around He is a nice guy and lectures very clearly. The tests can be challenging but are fair and relevant to the lectures. If you do not go to lecture you will probably do poorly as he uses the overhead to draw lots of figures that are not provided elsewhere. this is the prof to take this course with. Not inigo

Julian is a great prof. He really cares about the class as a whole doing well on his exams! If you go to class and take good notes, you'll be set for his exams. Just be careful with your wording as he is quite a picky marker. However, I still ended up with an A+ so his marking obviously wasn't too picky :P Highly recommend!

A great prof!! He makes the course really interesting. I had a lot of fun taking his bisc305 course. He draws diagrams in the lecture, so it's a good idea to attend his lectures although it's not mandatory. Exams were fair and fun! I remember there was a question about X-man :))
Great prof! Just listen to his lectures and you will be fine.  No textbook, so you only need to study your notes.

I have no idea why he doesn't have A LOT more ratings. I feel I can very confidently say on behalf of every single student in the class that he's one of everyone's favourite professors at SFU! Loved the course, thanks for everything!

Lectures are very entertaining, you'll never want to miss one! I'm not even a biology major but he totally captivated me in the subject matter and makes me *almost* want to change my degree. Definitely wait around to take courses when he's teaching them!

Fantastic prof - very friendly and helpful! Loved the lectures - very entertaining and great at getting information across in a way that makes it easy to retain.  I can't believe how much I  learned from this course (so much different from just memorizing a ton of facts and then forgetting them). Yea, he's pretty easy on the eyes too :-)

Awesome, young, fun! You don't need a textbook for his class ($$ saved), he's laid back and slightly dorky, but he makes class interesting. Exams are fair. I waited till summer semester to take 305 with him cuz that's the only time he teaches that course...definitely worth the wait.

His teachings feel almost backwards. Although the "review" is nice, his pace and material feel more diluted than the two courses pre-req to his class. I feel like an idiot for being in this so-called "4th" level course, expecting to learn something. It feels like a 200 level course. Either it's his fault or not, his teachings doesn't make it better

He went over the materials in class very slowly (about 12 slides per lecture), and the materials were easy to understand. But the exams were marked quite hard. Figures are not included in the notes, so if you need figures, you must buy the text book. Only one midterm though, so lots to know for midterm and final.

He is a great guy. you have to go to lecture cause his notes are skeleton notes.  His exam was fair, I found it easy, but some did poorly, but it was only short and long answer..it was based on the extra stuff he talked about in lecture.  If you go to lec then don't read the text.  doesn't pronounce things right though, can be irritating. nice guy!
nice smile, good class
